security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with code examples. No executable scripts, network calls, file system access, or external command execution capabilities were detected. The content describes a software planning methodology for structuring development projects.

content.value_statement: Breaking down complex software projects into manageable parts is challenging. This tool provides a structured methodology with modular decomposition, dependency modeling, and task sequencing to transform vague requirements into actionable development plans.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes project requirements into structured YAML specifications
Decomposes systems into independent functional modules with clear responsibilities
Models module dependencies to determine development order
Creates detailed task checklists with code examples for each module
Defines checkpoints and constraints for verifying deliverables
Provides Angular and TypeScript implementation examples
limitations: Does not execute code or generate files automatically
Does not integrate with project management tools
Does not estimate development time or effort
Does not validate technical feasibility automatically

use_cases.title: Design System Architecture
use_cases.description: Break down large systems into modules with clear dependencies before writing any code

use_cases.title: Plan Team Workflows
use_cases.description: Create structured development plans with ordered tasks and verification checkpoints for team execution

use_cases.title: Structure Refactoring Projects
use_cases.description: Plan complex refactoring efforts by defining module boundaries and dependency relationships

prompt_templates.title: New Project Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Software Planning Tool to help me plan a [PROJECT TYPE] for [DESCRIPTION]. The tech stack is [TECHNOLOGIES]. Apply the 5-stage planning process: 1) Requirements analysis, 2) Module decomposition, 3) Dependency analysis, 4) Task allocation, 5) Implementation checkpoints. Provide detailed module definitions with responsibilities, inputs, outputs, and dependencies.

prompt_templates.title: Module Addition
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding a new feature to existing system
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add [FEATURE] to an existing [SYSTEM TYPE]. Using the Software Planning Tool methodology, help me: 1) Define the new module's responsibilities and boundaries, 2) Identify which existing modules it depends on, 3) Determine what modules depend on it, 4) Create a task list with specific TypeScript/Angular code examples for implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Dependency Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the dependencies between these modules: [MODULE LIST]. Using the Software Planning Tool dependency modeling approach, create a dependency graph, identify the optimal development order, and suggest how to minimize coupling between modules.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me plan a refactoring of [COMPONENT OR SYSTEM]. Use the Software Planning Tool to: 1) Define current module boundaries and their issues, 2) Propose new modular structure, 3) Map out migration dependencies, 4) Create phased implementation tasks with rollback checkpoints at each stage.

output_examples.input: Plan a task management application with user authentication, project boards, task tracking, and team collaboration features using Angular and Supabase
output: Core Goals: User authentication, Project boards, Task CRUD, Real-time collaboration
Tech Stack: Angular 20.x, NG-ZORRO, Supabase, RxJS
Module 1: AuthModule - User login, token management, permission validation
Module 2: ProjectModule - Create/manage boards, member management
Module 3: TaskModule - Task CRUD, assignments, comments

best_practices: Start each project with clear requirements YAML before module decomposition
Define module boundaries with explicit inputs, outputs, and responsibilities
Validate dependency order ensures independent modules are completed first
Add specific code checkpoints like 'passes type check' or 'unit tests pass' to each task
anti_patterns: Skipping dependency analysis and discovering circular dependencies mid-development
Creating modules with overlapping responsibilities causing maintenance issues
Defining modules without clear inputs and outputs leading to integration problems
Building dependent modules before their dependencies are complete

faq.question: Does this skill work with frameworks other than Angular?
faq.answer: Yes. The methodology is framework-agnostic. The TypeScript examples can be adapted to React, Vue, or any OOP language.

faq.question: What project sizes benefit most from this approach?
faq.answer: Medium to large systems with multiple modules benefit most. Simple scripts or small apps may not need full decomposition.

faq.question: Can I combine this with other planning skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Use Software Planning Tool for overall architecture, then Sequential Thinking for individual module implementation details.

faq.question: Is my project data stored or shared anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based methodology. Your planning data stays in the conversation and is never transmitted externally.

faq.question: What if my requirements change mid-project?
faq.answer: Re-run the planning process with updated requirements. The modular structure helps isolate changes to specific modules.

faq.question: How is this different from general project management?
faq.answer: This focuses on technical decomposition with code-level tasks, dependencies, and implementation checkpoints rather than dates and milestones.
